title: Hindu Monk Chinmoy Brahmachari Arrested After Leading Protest In Bangladesh
content: Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, a Hindu priest and a religious minority leader in Bangladesh, was arrested in Dhaka amid tensions over minority rights in the country that has seen widespread political violence.
summary: Chinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, a Hindu priest and a religious minority leader in Bangladesh, was arrested in Dhaka amid tensions over minority rights in the country that has seen widespread political violence.

title: One Woman Killed By Partner, Relative Every 10 Minutes Worldwide: UN
content: One woman was killed by a partner or relative every 10 minutes worldwide in 2023, the United Nations warned Monday, stressing that femicides remained at "alarmingly high levels".
summary: One woman was killed by a partner or relative every 10 minutes worldwide in 2023, the United Nations warned Monday, stressing that femicides remained at "alarmingly high levels".

title: Australia PM Plays Down Privacy Fears Of Social Media Ban For Children
content: Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday social media firms would be required to destroy personal data used to verify ages of users, as part of what the government says is a world-leading ban on under-16s using the services.
summary: Australia Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Monday social media firms would be required to destroy personal data used to verify ages of users, as part of what the government says is a world-leading ban on under-16s using the services.

title: Malaysian Court Orders Return Of Swatch LGBTQ-Themed Watches
content: A Malaysian court ordered the government on Monday to return rainbow-coloured watches and accessories made by Swatch Group that were seized last year for designs celebrating LGBTQ rights, a prosecutor told Reuters.
summary: A Malaysian court ordered the government on Monday to return rainbow-coloured watches and accessories made by Swatch Group that were seized last year for designs celebrating LGBTQ rights, a prosecutor told Reuters.

title: 5 Interesting Facts About The FIDE World Chess Championship 2024
content: The 2024 FIDE World Chess Championship kicked off today at the Equarius Hotel in Singapore. The 18-year-old Indian chess prodigy, Grandmaster D Gukesh, is set to face off against the reigning world champion, Ding Liren of China.
summary: The 2024 FIDE World Chess Championship kicked off today at the Equarius Hotel in Singapore. The 18-year-old Indian chess prodigy, Grandmaster D Gukesh, is set to face off against the reigning world champion, Ding Liren of China.

title: Author Amitav Ghosh Wins Erasmus Prize For Writings On Climate Change
content: Acclaimed Indian author Amitav Ghosh has won the coveted Dutch Erasmus Prize for his writings on climate change and its impact on humanity, especially on the Indian subcontinent.
summary: Acclaimed Indian author Amitav Ghosh has won the coveted Dutch Erasmus Prize for his writings on climate change and its impact on humanity, especially on the Indian subcontinent.

title: Pakistan Reports 3 New Poliovirus Case, Total 55 This Year
content: Pakistan has reported three new poliovirus cases from Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provinces, taking the total number of infections this year to 55, according to a media report on Monday.
summary: Pakistan has reported three new poliovirus cases from Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provinces, taking the total number of infections this year to 55, according to a media report on Monday.

title: All About Romania's Pro-Russia Leader Likely To Be Next President
content: Romania's political landscape was left shocked after pro-Russia populist Calin Georgescu won the first round of the presidential election. The far-right leader knocked the EU-leaning premier out of the race that will be decided in a December run-off.
summary: Romania's political landscape was left shocked after pro-Russia populist Calin Georgescu won the first round of the presidential election. The far-right leader knocked the EU-leaning premier out of the race that will be decided in a December run-off.

title: Iran's Khamenei Calls For Death Sentence For Israeli Leaders
content: The supreme leader of Iran, which backs the Hamas and Hezbollah militants fighting Israel in Gaza and Lebanon, said on Monday that death sentences should be issued for Israeli leaders, not arrest warrants.
summary: The supreme leader of Iran, which backs the Hamas and Hezbollah militants fighting Israel in Gaza and Lebanon, said on Monday that death sentences should be issued for Israeli leaders, not arrest warrants.

title: Iraq's Population Rises To 45.4 Million As First Census Held In 30 Years
content: Iraq's population has risen to 45.4 million, according to preliminary results from a national census, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani said on Monday.
summary: Iraq's population has risen to 45.4 million, according to preliminary results from a national census, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani said on Monday.

title: Bestselling 'Woman Of Substance' Author Barbara Taylor Bradford Dies At 91
content: Bestselling British-American writer Barbara Taylor Bradford, whose first novel "A Woman of Substance" turned her into an overnight success, has died aged 91, a spokeswoman said on Monday.
summary: Bestselling British-American writer Barbara Taylor Bradford, whose first novel "A Woman of Substance" turned her into an overnight success, has died aged 91, a spokeswoman said on Monday.

title: Ava, Cute Golden Tigress From Thailand, Becomes Viral Sensation
content: Zoo authorities describe Ava is playful and sociable and is friendly towards children, in stark contrast with its predator image.
summary: Zoo authorities describe Ava is playful and sociable and is friendly towards children, in stark contrast with its predator image.

title: Satellite Images Suggest North Korea Expanding Missile Plant: Researchers
content: North Korea is expanding a key weapons manufacturing complex that assembles a type of short-range missile used by Russia in Ukraine, researchers at a US-based think tank have concluded, based on satellite images.
summary: North Korea is expanding a key weapons manufacturing complex that assembles a type of short-range missile used by Russia in Ukraine, researchers at a US-based think tank have concluded, based on satellite images.

title: Philippines Vice President 'Mastermind' Of Plot To Assassinate President: Justice Department
content: The Philippines justice department on Monday labelled Vice President Sara Duterte the "mastermind" of a plot to assassinate the country's president, giving her five days to respond to a subpoena.
summary: The Philippines justice department on Monday labelled Vice President Sara Duterte the "mastermind" of a plot to assassinate the country's president, giving her five days to respond to a subpoena.

title: French Rape Trial Must 'Change Relations Between Men, Women': Prosecutor
content: The trial in France of a man charged with enlisting dozens of strangers to rape his heavily-sedated wife has shaken French society and must fundamentally change relationships between men and women, a prosecutor said Monday.
summary: The trial in France of a man charged with enlisting dozens of strangers to rape his heavily-sedated wife has shaken French society and must fundamentally change relationships between men and women, a prosecutor said Monday.

title: Audi Drops Iconic Four Rings Logo In China, Internet Says "Bad Move"
content: The new AUDI logo is part of a project with Chinese automaker SAIC to co-develop electric vehicles aimed at attracting younger customers in the world's largest auto market.
summary: The new AUDI logo is part of a project with Chinese automaker SAIC to co-develop electric vehicles aimed at attracting younger customers in the world's largest auto market.

title: Video Captures Moment When Cargo Plane Crashed In Lithuania
content: At least one person died and three others were injured after a cargo plane crashed at Lithuania's Vilnius airport early on Monday. The Boeing 737-400, operated for DHL by the Spanish cargo airline Swiftair, was flying from Germany to Lithuania.
summary: At least one person died and three others were injured after a cargo plane crashed at Lithuania's Vilnius airport early on Monday. The Boeing 737-400, operated for DHL by the Spanish cargo airline Swiftair, was flying from Germany to Lithuania.

title: South Korean Man Caught Overeating To Avoid Military Service, Lands In Jail
content: The 26-year-old was sentenced to a year in prison, suspended for two years, under the Military Service Act.
summary: The 26-year-old was sentenced to a year in prison, suspended for two years, under the Military Service Act.

title: The Age Of MBS Has Begun: Saudi Prince's Influence On Economy Beyond Oil
content: Mohammed bin Salman's rise to power had been marked by extravagant spending, bold cultural reforms and a devastating war in Yemen.
summary: Mohammed bin Salman's rise to power had been marked by extravagant spending, bold cultural reforms and a devastating war in Yemen.

title: UK's King Charles Plans Visit To India Amid Health Concerns: Reports
content: Britain's King Charles III is reportedly planning an official visit to India early next year. Queen Camilla will accompany the King on the royal tour to the Indian subcontinent, which is part of a government-led charm offensive.
summary: Britain's King Charles III is reportedly planning an official visit to India early next year. Queen Camilla will accompany the King on the royal tour to the Indian subcontinent, which is part of a government-led charm offensive.
